verses.verse: Prayer and Praise for Deliverance from Enemies To the leader. A Psalm of David. (Ps 25.2; Isa 49.23) In you, O LORD, I seek refuge; do not let me ever be put to shame; in your righteousness deliver me.
(Ps 71.2) Incline your ear to me; rescue me speedily. Be a rock of refuge for me, a strong fortress to save me.
(Ps 18.2; 23.3) You are indeed my rock and my fortress; for your name’s sake lead me and guide me;
(Ps 25.15; 28.8) take me out of the net that is hidden for me, for you are my refuge.
(Lk 23.46; Acts 7.59) Into your hand I commit my spirit; you have redeemed me, O LORD, faithful God.
(Jon 2.8) You hate (Heb ms Gk Syr Jerome: MT I hate) those who pay regard to worthless idols, but I trust in the LORD.
(Ps 10.14; 90.14; Jn 10.27) I will exult and rejoice in your steadfast love, because you have seen my affliction; you have taken notice of my adversities
(Deut 32.30; Ps 4.1) and have not delivered me into the hand of the enemy; you have set my feet in a broad place.
Be gracious to me, O LORD, for I am in distress; my eye wastes away from grief, my soul and body also.
(Ps 13.2; 38.3; 39.11) For my life is spent with sorrow and my years with sighing; my strength fails because of my misery, (Gk Syr: Heb my iniquity) and my bones waste away.
(Ps 38.11; 64.8; Isa 53.4) I am the scorn of all my adversaries, a horror (Cn: Heb exceedingly) to my neighbors, an object of dread to my acquaintances; those who see me in the street flee from me.
(Ps 88.4, 5) I have passed out of mind like one who is dead; I have become like a broken vessel.
(Jer 20.10; Lam 2.20; Mt 27.1) For I hear the whispering of many— terror all around!— as they scheme together against me, as they plot to take my life.
(Ps 140.6) But I trust in you, O LORD; I say, “You are my God.”
(Job 24.1; Ps 143.9) My times are in your hand; deliver me from the hand of my enemies and persecutors.
(Num 6.25; Ps 4.6) Let your face shine upon your servant; save me in your steadfast love.
(Ps 25.2, 3) Do not let me be put to shame, O LORD, for I call on you; let the wicked be put to shame; let them go dumbfounded to Sheol.
(Ps 94.4; 120.2) Let the lying lips be stilled that speak insolently against the righteous with pride and contempt.
(Ps 5.11; Isa 64.4; Rom 11.22) O how abundant is your goodness that you have laid up for those who fear you and accomplished for those who take refuge in you, in the sight of everyone!
(Job 5.21; Ps 27.5) In the shelter of your presence you hide them from human plots; you hold them safe under your shelter from contentious tongues.
(1 Sam 23.7; Ps 17.7) Blessed be the LORD, for he has wondrously shown his steadfast love to me when I was beset as a city under siege.
(Ps 116.11; Lam 3.54) I had said in my alarm, “I am driven far (Heb mss: MT cut off) from your sight.” But you heard my supplications when I cried out to you for help.
(Ps 34.9; 94.2; 145.20) Love the LORD, all you his saints. The LORD preserves the faithful but abundantly repays the one who acts haughtily.
(Ps 27.14) Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the LORD.
